addressleaf.section:
To my LL. of
e Councell July 18. 90.

page.lettertext:
fol.207r
Belgia 1590 July
[.]
18 July To my
L. Trea
s
May it please yo
r
LL. to be advertised,
at
in o
r
conference w
t
e
General States
, about
e
affaires of o
r
charge, we
are
have bin
earnestly
intreated
re
qu
sted
by
e Whole Assembly, to addresse o
r
instant letters
to yo
r
LL for
e release of certaine
shippes
gooddes
of
these contreis, w
ch
have bin lately taken by
S
r
Martin Forbysher
, and sent into
e West partes of
England
. We have required their demaund
in writing, and they have delivered us that, wher-
of we send yo
r
LL. the copie, seeming all of
them to grieve exceedingly at this impechement
of their trafficke,
e dommage whiche their mar-
chants sustene, and
e ill usage otherwise, w
ch
hath bin offered there unto them. For o
r
owne
partes, we have endevored to persuade them,
at
this
their
complaint
of their marchants
is more am-
plified in wordes, then there is cause in deede,
and that it will be heard by yo
r
LL. w
t
all the
equitie and favo
r
, that they can any way require.
Nevertheles to induce them
e sooner to yelde her
Ma
tie
good
contentment in
at w
ch
we negotiat, and to stoppe
the mouthes of malignant persons, w
ch
take this
occasion already, and, as we are informed,
folowe it very bitterly, to sturre this people
against her Hig
nes
we beseeche yo
r
LL. that it
may stande w
t
yo
r
pleasures, to affourd
us
them
some
suche answear
to be imparted heere unto them,
as ether, if there cause so require, they may be
satisfied w
t
it or may perceave
at we have
written to procure their satisfaction.
And so we
take o
r
humble leave. From
e Hage. July 18.
A
o
1590.
Yo
r
LL. most humble at commaundem
t
Thomas Wilkes. Tho. Bodley.
